channel.title: Feedback really needed - Sylent
channel.description: Hey guys i just joined Auxy disco. And needed some support and feedback about my songs. I enjoy making Music and i really try to put my emotions to my songs. But there is always something missing that i cant understand in my songs. For example i listen to some of the Black oceans and austin hagas songs. But i never seem to want to listen to my songs. So i would really appreatice it if you could take a listen to some of my Song and tell me what is missing in my songs. Thanks :slight_smile:

item.title: Feedback really needed - Sylent
item.dc:creator: BlutoothCutthroat
item.description:
True, perhaps modulate would have been the better general word choice. Who doesn’t love an unresolved suspended 7th…

Read full topic

item.title: Feedback really needed - Sylent
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
BlutoothCutthroat:

Chords have to… resolve

Not necessarily. Chords that don’t resolve, for instance, where the end can segue neatly into the start, can help propel a groove and keep it going longer without losing the feeling of energy.

…thought that would probably fall under the compositional theory that you hint at.

Read full topic

item.description:
Ill try to do ny next Song like that

Read full topic

item.title: Feedback really needed - Sylent
item.dc:creator: BlutoothCutthroat
item.description:
Strictly my 2 cents for how I think of making a song. I’m sure there are far greater experts on here. You’re telling a story. Think of the structure as paragraphs of your story. Each section should have a beginning, middle and end or transition to the next. And each paragraph should propel your “story”, a bassline, melody or rhythmic phrase that speaks a complete sentence and will likely be revisited and enhanced or altered in subsequent paragraphs. I.e. Chords have to make some sense and resolve, melodies should try to stick to a recognizable scale, and then build on them later. But keep simplicity as the guiding factor. Too many voices and overthinking have ruined so many of my pieces.

Of course there is actual compositional theory that would address the technical side of things, but I’m speaking in broader conceptual terms.

Read full topic

item.title: Feedback really needed - Sylent
item.dc:creator: Sylent
item.description:
Thanks so much man . I will absouletly try to do better with kick and bass structure and will try to make it shorter.But really everyone says that i am bad at arrangement and i cant make it better any advices on that?

Read full topic

item.title: Feedback really needed - Sylent
item.dc:creator: BlutoothCutthroat
item.description:
Sylent you are anything but. Like the other folks said, some fundamental bass and kick structure would make the track pump better, but you have no shortage of ideas and arrangement skills. And my rule of thumb is, for an instrumental edm track, 3-4 min is when your listener is ready to check out. You really should LOVE your tracks. And after hearing this and the love and attention you spent on it, you actually do. Keep it up!

Read full topic

item.title: Feedback really needed - Sylent
item.dc:creator: SpaghettiSauce
item.description:
The third chord has a very dissonant feeling to it which makes the song unpleasant to listen to. When doing drums, try to find a rhythm. A simple “kick, snare” would be fine.

Read full topic

item.description:
Thanks for the critisizm and feedback i really needed .Some songs play the drop for a little at low sound at the start of the song so i thought i would do that too.Thanks again btw dont know if you remember it but i commented on many of your songs on soundcloud as Day and Night

item.title: Feedback really needed - Sylent
item.dc:creator: anon6476606
item.description:
OK! For Need You (I’m not trying to be rude, just constructive):

  • The chord progression is really nice at first, but the third chord kinda messes it up.
  • I don’t really understand why there’s a section at first and then it drops and starts building up. I suggest cutting out the whole beginning thing and starting at the buildup.
  • The Bo lead sounds like you were tapping random parts of the screen
  • I suggest fewer Whack snares
  • Maybe a more structured kick?
  • I really like the bass and chord instruments
  • Nice build up with Egg
  • The drop is nice but it’s cluttered up with extra drum stuff
  • I suggest making the Kiss with 100% tone, for easier to hear
  • The song is 5:08 which is a little long
  • Overall pretty repetitive, but nice composition and instrumentation look forward to hearing more!

Read full topic
